unnormalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gains Momentum in Maharashtra**
normalised: **smart meter rollout gains momentum in maharashtra**

unnormalised: Mumbai, October 26, 2023 – Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Co. Ltd. (MSEDCL) has announced significant progress in its smart meter deployment initiative across the state. As of today, over 50,000 smart meters have been installed in Nashik and Pune districts as part of the first phase.
normalised: mumbai, october twenty six, two thousand and twenty three – maharashtra state electricity distribution c o. l t d. (MSEDCL) has announced significant progress in its smart meter deployment initiative across the state. as of today, over fifty thousand smart meters have been installed in nashik and pune districts as part of the first phase.

unnormalised: The project, aimed at reducing Aggregate Technical & Commercial (AT&C) losses and improving billing efficiency, leverages advanced metering infrastructure (AMI) technology. Consumers will now be able to track their electricity consumption in near real-time via a dedicated mobile app, with data updates occurring every 15 minutes. This increased transparency is expected to encourage responsible energy usage and lower monthly bills.
normalised: the project, aimed at reducing aggregate technical and commercial (AT&C) losses and improving billing efficiency, leverages advanced metering infrastructure (A M I) technology. consumers will now be able to track their electricity consumption in near real-time via a dedicated mobile app, with data updates occurring every fifteen minutes. this increased transparency is expected to encourage responsible energy usage and lower monthly bills.

unnormalised: "This initiative is a crucial step towards modernizing our electricity grid," stated Shri. Patil, Chairman of MSEDCL, during a press conference held at 11:00 hrs today. The next phase, scheduled to begin on November 15, 2023, will target the Nagpur region. The Government of Maharashtra has allocated Rs. 2,000 Crore for the entire project, which aims to cover all urban areas by 2025. Future phases will include rural electrification, with plans to deploy an additional 2 lakh smart meters by Q1 2024.
normalised: "this initiative is a crucial step towards modernizing our electricity grid," stated shri. patil, chairman of MSEDCL, during a press conference held at eleven zero zero hours today. the next phase, scheduled to begin on november fifteen, two thousand and twenty three, will target the nagpur region. the government of maharashtra has allocated rupee two thousand crore for the entire project, which aims to cover all urban areas by two thousand and twenty five. future phases will include rural electrification, with plans to deploy an additional two lakh smart meters by Q one two thousand and twenty four.
